VAR-001.Description: Ensures variable names use an approved prefix, a correct suffix (if applicable), conform to a defined casing style (snake, pascal, or camel case), and include a Hungarian notation type prefix.
VAR-001.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' violates naming conventions. Expected prefix: {EXPECTEDPREFIXES}, casing: {CASESTYLE}, and Hungarian notation: {HUNGARIANNOTATION}.

VAR-002.Description: Validates that variable prefixes align with their exposure level, ensuring consistent naming practices that reflect variable scope and usage context.
VAR-002.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' uses a prefix inconsistent with its exposure '{EXPOSURE}'. Expected prefixes for '{EXPOSURETYPE}': {EXPECTEDPREFIXES}.

VAR-003.Description: Checks that variables intended for global access are properly prefixed, ensuring that naming conventions signal the variable's broader availability across environments.
VAR-003.Error Message: Global variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' lacks the correct prefix indicating its scope. Expected global prefixes: {EXPECTEDPREFIXES}.

VAR-004.Description: Limits variable name length to enhance readability and maintain coding standards, preventing excessively long names that can obscure code understanding.
VAR-004.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' exceeds the maximum allowed length of {LENGTH} characters.

VAR-005.Description: Ensures variables are declared within the appropriate stages of the process, reflecting their intended use and lifecycle, thus enhancing code structure and clarity.
VAR-005.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}', with prefix '{PREFIX}', must be declared within {EXPECTEDSTAGES} stages to align with its lifecycle.

VAR-006.Description: Ensures variables appear inside their designated color-coded blocks.
VAR-006.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' on page '{PAGENAME}' is not inside its assigned block. Found inside block '{BLOCKNAME}' with color '{BLOCKCOLOR}'.

VAR-007.Description: Variable names should not contain whitespace characters.
VAR-007.Error Message: Variable '{NAMEOFVAR}' contains whitespace, which is not allowed.

PAGE-001.Description: Ensures the process does not exceed a maximum page count to maintain manageability and navigability. Processes with too many pages can be difficult to maintain and navigate.
PAGE-001.Error Message: Process '{PROCESSNAME}' has exceeded the maximum allowed page count of {MAXPAGES}. Consider organizing content into additional processes or sub-processes for clarity.

PAGE-002.Description: Checks if the page has a description defined by checking the number of words in it.
PAGE-002.Error Message: The minimum number of words in the description box required are {WORDCOUNT}

PAGE-003.Description: Validates that preconditions and postconditions contain a minimum amount of detail.
PAGE-003.Error Message: Preconditions or postconditions for page '{PAGENAME}' must contain at least {WORDCOUNT} words. Current counts are {PREACTUALWORDCOUNT} and {POSTACTUALWORDCOUNT}.

STAGE-001.Description: Ensures each stage includes a narrative of sufficient length for documentation.
STAGE-001.Error Message: Stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' must contain a narrative of at least {WORDCOUNT} words.

STAGE-002.Description: Validates that Block stages include at least one Recover stage within their bounds to handle errors.
STAGE-002.Error Message: Block '{BLOCKNAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' does not contain a Recover stage for error handling.

STAGE-NAME-001.Description: Stage names must be unique within a page.
STAGE-NAME-001.Error Message: Stage name '{STAGENAME}' appears more than once on page '{PAGENAME}'.

STAGE-NAME-002.Description: Decision stage names should end with a question mark.
STAGE-NAME-002.Error Message: Decision stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' should end with a question mark.

STAGE-NAME-003.Description: Stage names should not contain special characters or end with punctuation.
STAGE-NAME-003.Error Message: Stage name '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' contains invalid characters or punctuation.

STAGE-DOC-001.Description: Specified stage types must include a narrative.
STAGE-DOC-001.Error Message: Stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' requires a narrative.

STAGE-ERR-002.Description: Recover stages must be paired with a Resume within the same block.
STAGE-ERR-002.Error Message: Recover stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' lacks a corresponding Resume stage.

STAGE-ERR-003.Description: Main page must contain a global error handler block with Recover and Resume or Exception stages.
STAGE-ERR-003.Error Message: Global error handler missing in block '{BLOCKNAME}'.

STAGE-DATA-001.Description: Data items with AlwaysInit or Private must define an initial value.
STAGE-DATA-001.Error Message: Data stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' requires an initial value.

STAGE-DATA-002.Description: Collection stages must define column structures.
STAGE-DATA-002.Error Message: Collection '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' lacks column definitions.

STAGE-ACT-001.Description: Action stage parameters must reference existing data items.
STAGE-ACT-001.Error Message: Action stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' references unknown stage '{REFNAME}'.

STAGE-ACT-002.Description: Action stages require both object and action names.
STAGE-ACT-002.Error Message: Action stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' must specify object and action names.

STAGE-LOOP-001.Description: LoopStart stages must have a matching LoopEnd with the same group id.
STAGE-LOOP-001.Error Message: LoopStart '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' has no matching LoopEnd stage.

STAGE-ANCHOR-001.Description: Anchor stages should start with the word 'Anchor'.
STAGE-ANCHOR-001.Error Message: Anchor stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' is not named correctly.

STAGE-POS-001.Description: Stages should not overlap on a page.
STAGE-POS-001.Error Message: Stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' overlaps another stage.

STAGE-POS-002.Description: Data and Block stages should use standard dimensions.
STAGE-POS-002.Error Message: Stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' does not match standard size.

STAGE-MISC-001.Description: Specified stages must have login inhibit enabled.
STAGE-MISC-001.Error Message: Stage '{STAGENAME}' on page '{PAGENAME}' should have login inhibit set.

STAGE-MISC-002.Description: Environment, Session or Statistic variables must be declared on the main page only.
STAGE-MISC-002.Error Message: Data '{STAGENAME}' with exposure '{EXPOSURE}' must be defined on the main page.
